derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: probably from an unrecorded Old English word related to (and perhaps reinforced in Middle English by) Middle Dutch maesche, of Germanic origin

entry.def: Mesh is material like a net made from wire, thread, or plastic.

example.ex: The ground-floor windows are obscured by wire mesh.
example.tran: 一楼的窗户装有防盗网。

example.ex: ...a mesh small enough to exclude tiny insects.
example.tran: 网眼小得足以挡住小昆虫的网

entry.tran: (使)相匹配;(使)相互协调;(使)吻合
entry.def: If two things or ideas mesh or are meshed, they go together well or fit together closely.

example.ex: Their senses of humor meshed perfectly...
example.tran: 他们的幽默感配合得天衣无缝。

example.ex: This of course meshes with the economic philosophy of those on the right...
example.tran: 这自然与右派的经济哲学相吻合。

means.word_mean: 1. the number of opening per inch of a screen; measures size of particles;
3. the topology of a network whose components are all connected directly to every other component
4. an open fabric of string or rope or wire woven together at regular intervals
5. the act of interlocking or meshing;

sentences.sentence: "an interlocking of arms by the police held the crowd in check"

means.word_mean: 2. coordinate in such a way that all parts work together effectively
4. entangle or catch in (or as if in) a mesh
